Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Fascial Plane Blocks in Chronic Pain Management

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included studies referencing 'fascial plane blocks' for chronic pain conditions such as persistent post-surgical, neuropathic, musculoskeletal-myofascial, and cancer-related pain.

Intervention.evidence: Adverse events were rare, with mild side effects reported in 3% of the intervention group and 1% of the control group.

Objective.evidence: This study aims to evaluate their efficacy and safety in chronic pain treatment.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was pain reduction, measured using standard scales over a 12-week period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation methods and allocation concealment were not specified in the included studies.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding of outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians was not consistently reported.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The effect size for pain reduction was significant, with a mean difference of 5.2 on the numeric rating scale (95% CI 3.1 to 7.3; p = 0.01).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were rare, with mild side effects reported in 3% of the intervention group and 1% of the control group.
